body:
### Description

I have enabled the vue language server (using Lazy.vim) with:

```lua
    {
        "neovim/nvim-lspconfig",
        opts = {
            servers = {
                vuels = {},
            }
        }
    }
```

When I open a Vue project, I get:

```
WARN /usr/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/lsp/_transport.lua:68: Spawning language server with cmd: `{ "vls" }` failed with error message: /usr/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/_system.lua:248: EACCES: permission denied: "vls"
```


Maybe I'm missing something, but the Vue LS binary is called `vue-language-server` and nvim-lspconfig has the command as `vls`. 

Manually updating the `cmd` to `vue-language-server`, the LS crashes on start:

```
[ERROR][2025-05-06 22:47:52] ...p/_transport.lua:36	"rpc"	"vue-language-server"	"stderr"	"/home/mike/.local/share/nvim/mason/packages/vue-language-server/node_modules/@vue/language-server/node_modules/vscode-languageserver/lib/node/main.js:192\n        throw new Error('Connection input stream is not set. ' + commandLineMessage);\n        ^\n\nError: Connection input stream is not set. Use arguments of createConnection or set command line parameters: '--node-ipc', '--stdio' or '--socket={number}'\n    at _createConnection (/home/mike/.local/share/nvim/mason/packages/vue-language-server/node_modules/@vue/language-server/node_modules/vscode-languageserver/lib/node/main.js:192:15)\n    at Object.createConnection (/home/mike/.local/share/nvim/mason/packages/vue-language-server/node_modules/@vue/language-server/node_modules/vscode-languageserver/lib/node/main.js:137:12)\n    at createConnection (/home/mike/.local/share/nvim/mason/packages/vue-language-server/node_modules/@vue/language-server/node_modules/@volar/language-server/node.js:30:19)\n    at Object.<anonymous> (/home/mike/.local/share/nvim/mason/packages/vue-language-server/node_modules/@vue/language-server/node.js:9:48)\n    at Module._compile (node:internal/modules/cjs/loader:1734:14)\n    at Object..js (node:internal/modules/cjs/loader:1899:10)\n    at Module.load (node:internal/modules/cjs/loader:1469:32)\n    at Function._load (node:internal/modules/cjs/loader:1286:12)\n    at TracingChannel.traceSync (node:diagnostics_channel:322:14)\n    at wrapModuleLoad (node:internal/modules/cjs/loader:235:24)\n\nNode.js v23.9.0\n"
```

comment_data.body:
The `vuels` configuration is for Vue's old language server. The config for the current one (`vue-language-server`) goes by [`volar`](https://github.com/neovim/nvim-lspconfig/blob/master/doc/configs.md#volar) in this project (because this was used as differentiator by Vue when it was released).

I was already planning to open an issue regarding renaming `volar`, because it doesn't fit anymore. This issue is a good example for why

title: vuels launches 'vls' when it should be 'vue-language-server'
